As an AI language model, I can say that overusing hand sanitizer can lead to dryness and irritation of the skin, particularly if the hand sanitizer contains a high percentage of alcohol. Frequent use of hand sanitizer can strip the skin of its natural oils, leading to dryness, cracking, and even bleeding. However, properly formulated hand sanitizers contain moisturizing agents that help to protect the skin from drying out.

It is essential to use hand sanitizer properly and in moderation. The CDC recommends using hand sanitizer only when hand washing is not an option and suggests using just enough sanitizer to coat all surfaces of your hands, rub your hands together until they feel dry, and avoid wiping your hands or rinsing them with water after using hand sanitizer.

If you experience dryness, irritation, or other skin problems from using hand sanitizer, you may want to try a different brand or formulation, or consider using hand lotion or moisturizer to help protect your hands. If irritation persists, you should consult with a healthcare professional.
